description:
The opportunity to make an impact

At AMP, we’re lucky to have an incredible team of people who believe in our promise, to help people live with financial dignity and security.

For the right candidates, we’re offering the opportunity to join this team and play a role in building the AMP of the future. We have several projects rolling out across our business that will give you the opportunity to make a direct impact on the lives of our customers.

We need more people who care passionately about delivering customer outcomes – because they care deeply about our customers and are committed to doing the right thing.
Through this focus, we’ll be making a significant contribution to the future of the financial services industry. You can help us to make this happen.


The flexibility to achieve your goals

We give you the ability to define what working means for you.

We want people ready to make an impact and we offer a wide range of flexible working options to make it easier for you to give your best. Whether this be part time or compressed hours, remote working or purchasing extra leave - we want to support you on your journey to achieve both your personal and professional goals.

At AMP, we care deeply about our employee’s wellbeing and we offer a range of benefits to support you financially, personally and professionally. From our onsite wellness center at our Circular Quay HQ, to volunteering opportunities and retail discounts, we are here to support you.

The value of an inclusive and diverse team

Our customers are many different people, and so are we. Which is perfect.
We need all kinds of ideas, approaches and perspectives to stay in tune with our customers and give them what they need. There's lots of diverse thinking at AMP and being inclusive lets us switch it on.
It sounds big, but we want to improve the lives of our customers, our people, our business partners and our communities by being a truly inclusive business.


A business that helps our people play to their strengths.

This means we:

  • invite and value different ways of thinking and doing things
  • harness this difference to innovate and make great decisions
  • tackle bias and inequity head on
  • create strong relationships with one another to create them with our customers and business partners; and
  • work together to build an environment that helps us be our best, every single day.

For us, inclusion is key to connecting with our people and customers. Without it, diverse thinking can never be heard.
We do a lot to help people play to their strengths, like making AMP a great place to work for both men and women. We look at the ways we recruit our people, develop and promote them, pay them and recognize and reward their performance.
Policies and practices that support all our people—like flexible work—are also incredibly important to finding and running a great team




Gender equality 

In 2017, AMP was once again named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Federal Government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency. 

AMP has gender targets in place and we remain committed to achieving them. We want women to hold 47% of senior executive roles and 50% of middle management roles by the end of 2020. These targets reflect our belief that an inclusive and diverse workplace delivers better results for our shareholders, customers, employees, business partners and communities. 

Health and wellbeing at AMP 

AMP offers a wide range of benefits and initiatives to employees as we recognise that health and wellbeing play an important role in a person's personal and professional life.    

AMP Advantage: 

AMP’s discount program, available online and via an app, gives employees access to more than 400 retailers offering savings on groceries, petrol, clothing, hotels, travel, electrical goods, music and much more.

Purchase leave: 

Need additional leave or more time away from the office? Employees can purchase up to 8 weeks of additional leave each year through salary deductions (subject to manager approval).  



Parental leave or the primary caregiver: 

AMP offers 14 weeks’ paid parental leave (this can be taken at half pay over 28 weeks if requested) on the birth or adoption of a child. 


Health and wellbeing program: 

The annual program includes health assessments, flu vaccinations and seminars. 



Onsite health clubs (Circular Quay & Parramatta): 

Our onsite health clubs offer quality equipment, fitness classes, access to massages, and personal training. Membership is just $10 per week pre-tax, deducted from the employee's salary. 

AMP corporate health plan: 

The AMP corporate health plan provided by Bupa offers health cover at reduced corporate rates. 

Employee Assistance Program (EAP): 

The EAP is a free, confidential counselling and advice service for personal and work-related problems. It’s open to employees and their immediate family, and is run by professional, independent consultants.  


Flexible work:  

Our 2017 People Survey showed that 69% of our workforce took part in some kind of flexible work. AMP offers a wide range of flexible working options from job sharing, to compressed and part time hours, as well as the ability to purchase leave and work remotely.


Giving back to the community

The AMP Foundation’s Community Program supports employees who volunteer with, or fundraise for, the social and community causes they are passionate about. The program includes: volunteering and mentoring activities that are organised for AMP employees every year, including preparing meals for people in need, creating support kits for children in foster care, donating blood or mentoring a disadvantaged student. The AMP Foundation will also dollar-match funds raised for a number of registered not-for-profits and community partners.
